newsitem.title: CANADA: Encal to buy B.C. oil assets for C$45.4 mln.
newsitem.headline: Encal to buy B.C. oil assets for C$45.4 mln.

text.p: Encal Energy Ltd said on Tuesday it agreed to acquire a package of British Columbia oil and gas properties from Morrison Petroleums Ltd for C$45.4 million.
Encal said the purchase included producing properties, undeveloped land, processing and gathering facilities, pipelines and other assets located in the Fort St. John region of northeast B.C.
The deal provides Encal with new production of 930 barrels of oil and 8.5 million cubic feet of natural gas per day, the company said.
It said third-party reserve data indicated proven reserves of 5.4 million barrels of oil equivalent (BOE) and probable reserves of 1.6 million BOE.

Other assets in the package included oil processing and compressor facilities, 81,000 net acres of undeveloped land and about 1,000 km of seismic data, which are valued by Encal at approximately C$12 million.

"Net of the other assets, the acquisition cost of proven reserves is below our three year historical finding and development costs of C$6.67 per BOE," Encal chief executive David Johnson said in a statement. "We expect lower corporate general and administration expenses per BOE upon completion of this acquisition."
Encal said the purchase would be financed with existing lines of credit. Closing was expected in late January 1997 with the effective date being January 1.
